dataset.title: Harmful Algal Bloom (HAB) data collected from multiple pier stations along the California coast by the Scripps Institution of Oceanography (Darwin Core Archive format)

abstract.para: California Harmful Algal Bloom Monitoring and Alert Program (HABMAP) provides updates on current algal blooms and facilitates information exchange among HAB researchers, managers and the general public in California. A major component of this program is regional HAB monitoring. Water samples and net tows are collected once per week to monitor for HAB species and naturally occurring algal toxins. Water quality data including temperature, salinity, and nutrients are also collected. The sampling stations currently represented in this dataset include Cal Poly Pier, Monterey Wharf, Newport Pier, Santa Cruz Wharf, Santa Monica Pier, Scripps Pier, and Stearns Wharf. This data is consolidated and reformatted into Darwin Core Archive (DwC-A) format from the level 1 site-specific datasets hosted on the Southern California Coastal Ocean Observing System (SCCOOS) ERDDAP server (https://erddap.sccoos.org/erddap/tabledap/index.html?page=1).

intellectualRights.para: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution (CC-BY) 4.0 License.

contact.positionName: USC Associates Captain Allan Hancock Chair in Marine Science and Professor of Biological Sciences

publisher.organizationName: Southern California Coastal Ocean Observing System (SCCOOS)

attribute.attributeDefinition: Row identifier

textDomain.definition: Row identifier

attribute.attributeDefinition: An identifier for the set of information associated with an Event (something that occurs at a place and time). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

textDomain.definition: An identifier for the set of information associated with an Event (something that occurs at a place and time). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The date-time or interval during which an Event occurred. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context.
The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given in decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude as based.

textDomain.definition: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given in decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude as based.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Comments or notes about the Event.

textDomain.definition: Comments or notes about the Event.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.
An identifier for the set of location information (data associated with dcterms:Location). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

textDomain.definition: An identifier for the set of location information (data associated with dcterms:Location). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The lesser depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.
The greater depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the Location. Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates). Zero is not a valid value for this term.

attribute.attributeDefinition: An identifier for the Occurrence (as opposed to a particular digital record of the occurrence). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the occurrenceID globally unique.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the IdentificationQualifier term.
